Perceptor:

"I would have wished that the things have been in other way too, when I came 
back to BlackFortress I know that things never would be as it used to"said 
Perceptor with a true upain in his voice while he shaked rodimus's hand"i 
really will miss you.. both; But I never will consent a reprogramation and 
with out that I never will be fully accepted... One last thing, It's the 
only thing i can do for her: I hadnt time to do a full reprogramation 
process in her, so it would be easy to get her back to her normal status and 
care her carfully, Hydras will try to capture her again... just to reach 
you; I cant promise anything... But if that happen, I'll do my best to 
protect her... It's the only thing that I can do."

> Rodimus set his weapon to mid setting, "RUN!" he barked at Perceptor,
> "RUN NOW!" Rodimus took aim at perceptor as he prepared to pull the
> trigger!

"The Shot must be in front, Rodimus"replied Perceptor while he moved 
backwards"if we are trying to fool Hydras, we have to do it right... He 
knows that a Autobot never does a treacherous shoot... You can do it in 
front, never at the back... and in that way will make things easier next 
time..."

"Dont cross in my way, Rodimus"while he tried to hold his emotions that for 
first time in centuries overhelmed him "I dont want to have to destroy 
you... You and Nightlight were the only friends that I had..."he sighed"The 
kid was right, I'm aging"


--------------------------------------------------
From: "Preston Carroll" <supercyclonus@...>
Sent: Monday, May 03, 2010 11:33 AM
To: <nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com>
Subject: Re: The Light of the Flame!

> Who: RODIMUS PRIME, Tuscon, Nightshift, Darkhawk, Perceptor
> Location: Black Fortress - Tunnels beneath the Black Fortress
>
>> "I have a better idea"said dryly the Predacon while he took a bif nail's
>> Artifact and nailed in in ground"Acording with vibrations he is closest 
>> and
>> this is the good bye time"and facing to Rodimus added in a slight 
>> ironical
>> tone "Try not cry for my depart"and returning to his dry custome 
>> tone"this
>> thing will mess with Scorponok, mine and possible with Tucson's circuits 
>> so
>> you wont be close when it turns on, you have... 5 cycles to run, the 
>> exit,
>> follow straight this tunnel; In this way I can seal this exit, cover my
>> tracks and if I'm lucky enough Kill Skorponok, Hydras isnt very fond of 
>> him
>> anyway; I suspect that he and Zarak are up to something, I had a hard 
>> time
>> stop their trip to the Ark some weeks ago... " after he had set that 
>> device
>> he stood on and looking to Rodimus said " One last Favor Rodimus, I need
>> that you shoot me"
>
> Rodimus stopped and stared at the Predacon, his face betraying the
> mixture of anger and sorrow at the situation. It may have even seemed
> for a moment like he was about to balk at the whole idea, but finally
> he shook his head, even as a steely resolution came across it.
> "You're're right." Rodimus said at length. "It is the only way."
>
> Rodimus held out his hand to Perceptor to shake it, one comrade to
> another. "I have respect you old soldier." Rodimus said. "However when
> we next meet, it will be as enemies." Rodimus sighed, "But I wish
> there could have been a better choice, a different choice." Rodimus
> glanced at Perceptor's Predacon badge, and then back at Perceptor.
>
> After they shook hands Rodimus looked over at Tuscon, "You know the
> way now, just go towards the surface. I will hold them off, and
> Nightshift if he is willing!"
>

>
